The ministry advised citizens to be cautious of new online contacts and discouraged travel to Russia, citing the risk of arrest.
original:
The German Foreign Ministry warned Germans that “beautiful young women from Russia” on dating apps are agents of Russian intelligence services, ZDF TV channel reports. “Be careful with Tinder, Hinge, Bumble and so on: there may be false motives behind new contacts. Russia at present "Time is not the best place for a first date with online flirting," the German Foreign Ministry said.

Also, the department does not recommend that German citizens travel to Russia, as they allegedly face arrest there. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

description: A Russian GRU special forces brigade conducted a reconnaissance operation in the Kherson region in September 2023. The mission aimed to clear islands on the Dnieper River of enemy forces. During the operation, the group discovered a stronghold, engaged in a firefight, and suffered casualties. After regrouping, they successfully flanked the enemy, captured prisoners, and retreated with valuable intelligence.
original:
The work of one of the reconnaissance groups of the 10th separate special forces brigade of the Russian GRU.
Archival footage, September 2023, Kherson region.
The command of the group of troops was assigned
Show more
clear the islands on the Dnieper River from the enemy. During reconnaissance and search operations, a small stronghold was discovered, where there were about 12 people (2 machine gunners). Having entered into a shooting battle, the group suffered casualties in the person of the deputy commander of the reconnaissance group. The decision was made to withdraw. He would later, unfortunately, die due to the long evacuation.
A couple of days later, it was decided to move into this area again, where it was discovered that the enemy had taken even more advantageous positions on a small hill and set up in the letter “G”.
The group commander moved to the site of the previous battle, dug in and conducted observation ~170m from the enemy. Observation and eavesdropping continued for a couple of days, after which a decision was made to flank. As a result, the head patrol discovered the trenches, after which, after transmitting the coordinates, it was decided to strike the FAB UMPC there. A day later, the FAB finally arrived, but did not reach 150-160m. And if the group had not deliberately moved another 300m to the south, then he would have hit his own people.
As a result, we decided to do everything ourselves. The group commander walked around the strong point from the right flank and discovered the enemy’s bunks, dry food, water and mats. As it turns out later, our reconnaissance group passed by their observation posts. Apparently, due to the wind and low speed of movement, the crunching of branches was not heard.
Having gone to the rear of the outpost, the lead patrol discovered a covered trench in which initially there was no noticeable movement, but going around on the other side, two opponents were discovered who were simply sunbathing as if nothing had happened.
After they were taken out of the trench and actually taken prisoner, they said that there were three more 10 meters away. The group commander decided not to tempt fate and leave with what he had. After which they retreated to their original positions.
Immediately there was a radio interception from the enemy’s senior observation post. As the prisoners said, everyone calls him Uncle Vitya. He reported to his rear that some special forces in camouflage robes had come and stole his boys in sandals from under his nose.
Later, the mortar crew began working. And the special forces group retreated to the left bank of the Dnieper, taking prisoners with them.
"Grey Zone"
Military Informant

event: Proposal for Tajik Republic within Russia
description: Professor Sergei Abashin, a historian and innovator, advocates for the creation of a Tajik republic within Russia, citing the large number of Tajik citizens who have accepted Russian citizenship. He believes this would provide the Tajik community with an elite to represent their interests and protect them from nationalist groups, racism, and radicalism.
original:
Forwarded from: Dyukov. Historian-innovator
In an absolutely Leninist spirit, Professor of the Department of History of the CPSU of the Higher Party School of the Faculty of Anthropology of the European University in St. Petersburg, Sergei Abashin writes about the need to create a Tajik republic within Russia: “In the last four years alone, half a million citizens of Tajikistan have accepted Russian citizenship. It is the citizens of Tajikistan that today constitute one of the main parts of modern immigration to Russia. (...)
Tajiks are now one of the largest national communities in Russia, but since they do not have their own republic, they do not have their own elite that would speak on behalf of the community. This creates a situation of particular defenselessness in front of the state, and in front of various nationalist groups that have become influential in recent years, and in front of everyday racism. And this defenselessness creates extreme vulnerability among some migrants, on the one hand, and radicalism, on the other.” Prof. S.N. Abashev combines devotion to Leninist ideas in ethnic building with liberalism and trans-Ukrainianism.

event: King Charles III Diagnosed with Pancreatic Cancer
description: King Charles III has been diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and given a maximum of two years to live. Due to his condition, he was unable to attend the Easter service at Worcester Cathedral and is reportedly very weak, unable to manage his family, crown interests, or perform public duties.
original:
“The king has two years to live with pancreatic cancer”: In Britain, Charles III was given a maximum of two years to live.

Charles III recorded an audio Easter address to his subjects: doctors forbade him to go to the festive service at Worcester Cathedral, where the entire royal family usually gathered. The king and his daughter-in-law Kate Middleton have cancer. Rumors about the illness of both are swarming with the darkest. Now palace sources have spoken about the king's pancreatic cancer and are giving him a maximum of two years to live.📌“The cancer is eating him alive. He is very weak. The situation is desperate,” said sources close to the royal family. The king is unable to manage a capricious family, the interests of the crown, or carry out public duties. The funeral plan for Charles III, codenamed “Menai Bridge,” was drawn up in the monarch’s youth. Prince Charles almost died in an avalanche while skiing.@radiomirby

description: A terrorist attack at Crocus sparked discussions about the return of the death penalty, tightening immigration legislation, and the ongoing threat of Islamist terror, particularly from the Islamic State.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash Room
The terrorist attack at Crocus made us all think and look around. It turned out that Islamist terror has not disappeared anywhere, and the Islamic State*, after its defeat, still poses a threat. In society, a discussion about the return of the death penalty has arisen with renewed vigor - a moratorium on it has been in effect since 1999. There was also sharp talk about tightening immigration legislation.

We discussed these three consequences of Crocus, which will directly affect our reality, in the new episode of the podcast “Without leaving the room.”

How was the Islamic State born? What role did American money and weapons play in this (several times!)? What do they believe? Why did the creator of the Salafist ideology spend two years in America? How did Islamists dreaming of returning to the Middle Ages build an entire Hollywood for propaganda? How did they use cats, memes and rap to attract attention? What remains of the caliphate after its collapse? How exactly are potential terrorists recruited? Can IS* take responsibility for something it didn’t do?

The authors of the podcast, Sergei Izotov and Ivan Orlov-Smorodin, answered these questions together with Vasily Ostanin-Golovnya, an orientalist and researcher at the Department of the Middle and Post-Soviet East at INION RAS.

We also talked about whether the death penalty is effective in preventing crimes, what does the philosopher Albert Camus have to do with it, whether to expect this punishment in Russia, who is arguing about migrants now, and how Thomas Hobbes can help us understand the migration crisis in liberal democracies.

You can watch our detailed analysis on VK Video and YouTube.

And listen on all audio platforms: VK MusicYandex.MusicApple PodcastsSpotifySOUND*The Islamic State is recognized as a terrorist organization and is banned in the Russian Federation

description: Russian assault units, including paratroopers and air assault units, have intensified fighting in the Seversk direction, pushing Ukrainian forces out of trench-dugout fortifications and advancing along the Nyrkovo-Vyemka railway line. The Russian Armed Forces have gained control of approximately 7 sq. km of new territory.
original:
Seversk directionAssault units of the Russian Armed Forces began moving in the area of the settlement. Razdolovka.
There has been no active activity here for more than six months.

Now there is an intensification of fighting at the line:
Veseloye - Disputed - Verkhnekamenskoe.

The paratroopers of the 51st regiment of the 106th Tula Airborne Division, with fire support from FPV drone operators and crews of the SAO 2S9 "Nona-S", gave a decent blow to the hohlobes, squeezed out the Ukrainian fascists of the 10th mountain assault brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces from several trench-dugout fortifications and carried out progress on the section Vesyoloye - Vyemka along the Nyrkovo - Vyemka railway line.

And to the west of Vesyoly, the air assault units of the 137th RPD drove the Ukronazis and advanced towards the southern flank of a large fortified area of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the village. Razdolovka.

Our troops advanced almost a kilometer southeast of Razdolovka.

The area of new territories that have come under the control of the RF Armed Forces in this section is about 7 sq. km.

Fierce fighting is currently taking place near the Vyemka railway station.
The ASUs managed to recapture their positions in the landings along the railway.

The entire front north of Soledar is very active right now.

"Diary of a Trooper"

description: Sergei Chesnokov, a member of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation, warned that Russia's birth rate will decline until 2030-2035, leading to an 'old age trap' if not addressed. This demographic problem poses risks to the state, including economic stagnation and social depressive processes, as the aging population becomes less mobile and dynamic.
original:
BRIEFINGPhoto, Summary-1.
@rusbriThe birth rate in Russia will fall until 2030-2035. If the demographic problem is not solved, the country will face an “old age trap,” said Sergei Chesnokov, a member of the coordination council of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation for national projects and conservation of people. “The situation with a decline in the birth rate will worsen until 2030, and possibly until 2035. A whole series of waves are superimposed in demography, which lead to negative aspects,” the demographer emphasized. According to the expert, the problem with the birth rate threatens the state with a number of risks, because we are talking about the aging of the population. “This is called “the burden of the elderly,” which leads to economic stagnation and various types of depressive processes in society. Society is aging, it is no longer so mobile, dynamic, new initiatives, changes are going worse, because the general mood is set by older people. If life expectancy increases and the birth rate falls, then this leads precisely to the trap of old age,” Chesnokov explained.

description: In Sviblovo, a family of teachers was attacked by migrants living in a noisy apartment. The father was punched when he asked them to be quieter, and the wife's arm was broken when she intervened. The instigator escaped to Uzbekistan after interrogation, while the others remain in the apartment.
original:
❗️In Sviblovo, migrants attacked a family of teachers - the instigator of the fight managed to escape back to their homeland. For five years, residents of the capital's Sviblovo district have been complaining about the events taking place in an apartment where at least 10 migrants live. The owners of neighboring living spaces are constantly disturbed by noise, screams, sounds of impacts and unsanitary conditions both in the apartment itself and on the landing. A large number of residents, as well as guests staying overnight, led to the appearance of bedbugs and cockroaches in the apartment, locals told Readovka.

On the night of March 9-10, a fight broke out among noisy neighbors once again. The father of the family decided to resolve the conflict on the floor below, but when asked to be quieter, since his two-year-old child and wife were sleeping at home, the migrants attacked him with their fists. The wife came running to help her husband, and subsequently one of the instigators of the fight broke her arm.

The cowardly fighter managed to fly back to his homeland, Uzbekistan, after interrogation by law enforcement agencies, the police told the victim a little later. The rest of the intruders, according to the family, continue to live in the apartment and are in no hurry to move out. Whether any punishment awaits them for participating in the beating of an entire family - history is silent.

"Readovka"

description: A resident of Makhachkala was sentenced to three years in prison for torturing her nine-year-old stepdaughter. The court found her guilty of systematic beatings, resulting in a closed craniocerebral injury, multiple bruises, and abrasions.
original:
A resident of Makhachkala was sentenced to a term in a colony for torturing her stepdaughter. THIS MATERIAL (INFORMATION) WAS PRODUCED AND DISTRIBUTED BY A FOREIGN AGENT LLC "MEMO", OR CONCERNES THE ACTIVITIES OF A FOREIGN AGENT LLC "MEMO". 18+

The court sentenced a resident of Makhachkala to three years in prison, finding her guilty of torturing her husband’s nine-year-old daughter.

“The court, having indicated that the defendant’s criminal act was objectively confirmed by the totality of the evidence presented, found her guilty of committing a crime and sentenced her to imprisonment for a term of three years to be served in a general regime correctional colony,” Mamaeva was quoted as saying on March 29.” Interfax".

The court concluded that from the summer of 2021 to April 22, 2023, out of personal hostility, the defendant systematically beat her husband’s nine-year-old daughter from a previous marriage. “After another execution, the girl early in the morning escaped from home to her mother. The latter, seeing her daughter’s condition, took her to the doctor. According to the results of the examination, the victim was found to have a closed craniocerebral injury, multiple bruises and abrasions,” said a court representative .

Read more: https://www.kavkaz-uzel.eu/articles/398566Caucasian Knot A resident of Makhachkala was sentenced to a prison term for torturing her stepdaughter. The court sentenced a resident of Makhachkala to three years in prison, finding her guilty of torturing nine...

event: Cancellation of Emergency Power Outage Schedules
description: Emergency power outage schedules were canceled in six regions in Ukraine, including Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, Kirovohrad, Poltava, and Sumy, due to repairs on damaged equipment. However, hourly restrictions remain in place for 120,000 consumers in the Kharkiv region.
original:
Emergency power outage schedules canceled in six regions. On Saturday, March 30, emergency power outage schedules were canceled in six regions in Ukraine. Hourly restrictions apply only in the Kharkiv region for 120,000 consumers. This was reported by the press service of the Ministry of Energy of Ukraine.

The agency explained that it is impossible to transmit the necessary amount of electricity in Kharkiv Oblast due to damage to the equipment of NEC "Ukrenergo". Instead, restrictions were lifted for subscribers in Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, Kirovohrad, Poltava and Sumy regions. Send news to Focus. IWatch YouTube channel of Focus.

description: Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zakharova criticized Pugacheva and Makarevich for their statements following the terrorist attack at Crocus, accusing them of hypocrisy and betrayal. Zakharova pointed out that both artists had spoken out on other occasions, including the deaths of Mikhail Gorbachev, Boris Moiseev, Alexander Gradsky, and Boris Krasnov.
original:
“I would say that this is hypocrisy. But this is something worse. Closer to betrayal. Millions believed them!” Zakharova condemned the statements of Pugacheva and Makarevich* after the terrorist attack at Crocus. An official representative of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs noted that it was “scary and wild” to hear that “one must mourn in silence” from people of art.

The diplomat recalled that Makarevich was not silent either when Mikhail Gorbachev died, or after the events of October 7 in Israel. Pugacheva, Zakharova added, was not silent when Boris Moiseev, Alexander Gradsky and Boris Krasnov died.

*foreign agent

description: Sudden warming caused widespread flooding in the Altai region, affecting over 600 household plots and 90 houses across nine settlements. Eight road sections were closed, and 70 people, including 22 children, were evacuated to two accommodation centers. The worst-hit areas were Rubtsovsk, Mikhailovsky, and Shipunovsky districts, where the only mode of transportation is swimming.
original:
The Altai region was flooded due to sudden warming; more than 600 household plots were under water. A state of emergency has been introduced in the region.

Too warm a spring has become a problem for the Altai Territory. Meltwater is rapidly drowning the houses of local residents: about 90 houses and 600 household plots in nine settlements have already been damaged. Eight sections of roads are closed.

People had to be evacuated: there are now 70 people in two accommodation centers, including 22 children. At the same time, seven more points are ready.

The worst situation is in Rubtsovsk, Mikhailovsky and Shipunovsky districts. The only way to get around there is by swimming. In the Yarovoe area, the ground sank several meters, presumably also due to flooding. Operational groups work in the region: 234 people and 92 units of equipment.

description: The Ukrainian conflict has led to a resurgence of mercenarism in the West, with Ukraine actively recruiting notorious thugs from around the world through diplomatic missions. This is a stark contrast to Russia, where the legislative framework for foreign military service has existed for a long time.
original:
Forwarded from: Let's figure it out!
Condottieri in the service of the Ukrainian ReichThe history of mercenaries goes back centuries. For hard money, it was customary to hire professional warriors who, in addition to military affairs, also carried out murders and robberies for their own enrichment. It is known that such a tradition of “warriorism” took root in medieval Europe. At the same time, condottieri were hired in fairly large formations. The comrades knew that loners do not live long, and the dead will not take advantage of the prey.

In modern times, mercenarism in the West has flourished with renewed vigor. Since the beginning of the Ukrainian conflict, the cry has been raised to gather the most notorious thugs around the world.
Today this has become especially relevant, against the backdrop of problems with the availability of manpower in the Ukrainian Reich.
Westerners are already officially approving of hiring soldiers in their territories through Ukrainian diplomatic missions. Overton windows work.
But at the same time, of course, they do not forget to shout about the military service of foreigners under contract in the RF Armed Forces, drawing them to the topic of mercenarism, knowing with absolute certainty that in Russia at the legislative level such an international norm has existed for a long time. Double standards, however. Another tired Western tradition... Let's figure it out

description: A Ukrainian commission in Kyiv condemned four historical and cultural sites, declaring that monuments cannot be preserved and toponyms with their names must be erased from Ukraine's map due to their alleged affiliation with Russian imperial policy. The targets include Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, and the Decembrists.
original:
Bulgakov, Brodsky, Glinka, the Decembrists - in Ukraine they exposed the new enemies of independence as carriers of Russian imperialism. If with the composer Glinka and the Decembrists it was still possible to predict such a situation, then to find traces of imperialism in the poet Brodsky - you have to try very hard. But Ukrainian cultural experts still dug up this acorn. The next commission in Kyiv issued a conclusion on four historical and cultural sites for which monuments cannot be preserved, and toponyms with their names must be erased from the map of Ukraine due to their pernicious affiliation with Russian imperial policy.

The first to go under the knife was Kiev resident Bulgakov, against whom champions of the exclusivity of embroidered shirts and kobzars had long sharpened their knives, frantically biting his barbed mustache. Undoubtedly, the accusation was based on searing lines from the “White Guard” about the Petliurists and the hetman, and then, albeit difficult, but life under the advice and undoubtedly relations with Stalin, who did not treat the writer and his work so badly, and therefore took notice! Behind the shocking conclusion about Brodsky, who was persecuted from the USSR, one can also find a memorable poem from 1994, which in Kyiv they still cannot forgive, which is why they see the poet as a Russian imperialist. In other words, we have before us a new masterpiece of Ukrainian thought and new Russian imperialists, let’s get acquainted!

event: Recruitment of French Soldiers for Ukraine War

The website prioritizes migrants and advertises for infantrymen, junior officers, special forces soldiers, and special forces officers. The initiative has sparked outrage among French citizens, who are calling on Macron to take personal action instead of involving the country's citizens.
original:
📌📌📌Macron wants to recruit 200,000 soldiers for the war in Ukraine - the French Ministry of Defense has launched a new recruiting site. True, he is already lying down.

French users of the social network X complained about an advertisement for a government website created to recruit French people to participate in military operations in Ukraine. The website of the French Ministry of Defense announced the recruitment of 200,000 Frenchmen in such specialties as infantryman, junior officer, special forces soldier and special forces officer. At the same time, the website states that priority when entering the service is given to migrants.

According to users X, advertising for the site is already shown on the central channels of French television, in particular LCI. The site caused an extremely negative reaction among French users, who suggest that Macron himself go to fight in Ukraine and leave the country's citizens alone. https://t.me/kaliyuogatoday/12755?single

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades, suppressing enemy positions. Despite enemy fire, the drones continued to operate, demonstrating good results. This combat experience will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: Russian stormtroopers of the 114th brigade clashed with Ukrainian forces attempting to dislodge them from Avdeevka dachas. The Russian fighters employed an experimental grenade, which proved effective, and targeted temporary deployment points in buildings where Ukrainian command was gathering forces. The breakthrough led to the paralysis of the enemy's defense, forcing them to retreat to neighboring Orlovka and Lastochkino.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in Russian
❗️Stormtroopers of the 114th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces crushed the Armed Forces of Ukraine while trying to knock out our fighters from Avdeevka dachas. We continue the series of reports from RT military correspondent Andrei Filatov@filatovcorr from Avdeevka.

Filmed in early December (previously, publishing these shots was simply dangerous for our soldiers). Then the Ukrainian militants entered the BMP, but the unloading of the infantry was unsuccessful.

During the battles, our guys used an experimental grenade, which was a single copy, Filatov said: “Where we had already thrown several “efs” [F-1 grenade], the enemy sat lightly. Apparently the dugout is good and deep. But they threw this experimental one at them - it banged very well.” Russian fighters also opened fire at temporary deployment points in buildings where the command of the Ukrainian Armed Forces was trying to accumulate forces for the next attacks.

The breakthrough of Russian fighters through the Avdeevka dachas was important. The enemy's defense was paralyzed, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces retreated to neighboring Orlovka and Lastochkino.

Don’t miss Filatov’s reports about the battle for access to the “road of life” of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Avdeevka. The first part is here, the second is here. Other exclusive stories from a military correspondent from Avdeevkitutitut.#Military CorrespondentsRTRT in Russian. Subscribe

description: Real disposable income of American households fell by 0.1% in February, marking a decline in income dynamics and depletion of savings. This trend is expected to continue, leading to a drop in demand as consumption against debt becomes unsustainable.
original:
Forwarded from: Spydell_finance
The slide into recession in the US is becoming increasingly clear - extremely weak income dynamics and almost complete depletion of savings. Real disposable income of American households fell by 0.1% m/m in February, after zero dynamics in January and weak December, when inflation-adjusted incomes grew by only 0.2% m/m.

Accordingly, during the winter season (Dec. 23-Feb. 24 inclusive), real disposable income increased by a symbolic 0.1% versus a record growth of 2.6% a year earlier. If we do not take the period of high inflation in 2022, from 2014 to 2020 (before the first lockdowns) During this period, real incomes grew by an average of 1.2%.

The result was weaker in the crisis year 2009 (minus 0.8%) and in the inflationary year 2022 (minus 2.5%), as well as in 2013 (minus 3.8%) due to the technical factor of additional dividend accrual in November, which distorted the calculation base by 4 percentage points. In terms of expenses, +0.4% in Feb.24, minus 0.2% in Jan.24 and +0.5% in Dec.23, and for three months it turns out to be +0.67% - this is almost half as much as the consumer boom a year earlier (+1.15%), but higher than the average rate in 2014-2020 at the level of 0.5% for the winter period. The savings rate collapsed to 3.6% or 746 billion in annual terms, and on average for the winter the savings rate was 3.9% vs 4.2% a year earlier, which is 2 p.p. below 2014-2020 (6.2%), i.e. consumption is maintained solely through savings. It should be noted here that BEA revised down the volume of non-mortgage interest expenses from Oct.23 to Feb.24 with an accumulated total of an impressive 148 billion, which led to an overestimation of the savings rate by 0.25 percentage points due to manipulation with student loans.

The trend is negative. Incomes have actually stopped growing since May 2023 - growth in real terms is only 0.6%, savings rates are at historical lows, and interest expenses are steadily eating into household balance sheets, taking 2.6-2.8% of income, excluding mortgages vs 1.8-2% before cycle of tightening monetary policy. Consumption against debt will no longer be possible, so a drop in demand is inevitable - all internal resources of sustainability have been exhausted.

description: The South Korean Institute of Fusion Energy's KSTAR reactor achieved a record plasma confinement time of 48 seconds at a temperature of 100 million °C, surpassing the previous record of 30 seconds. This milestone brings the reactor closer to its target and demonstrates significant progress in fusion energy research.
original:
Forwarded from: Geoenergy INFO
A Korean fusion reactor ignited a plasma seven times hotter than the Sun's core for a record 48 seconds. The South Korean Institute of Fusion Energy (KFE) announced that it has achieved a new record for plasma confinement time by the KSTAR reactor. By December 2023, the reactor had undergone partial modernization, which raised the bar for its capabilities. The first three months of its operation in the new configuration allowed it to surpass the previous record of plasma confinement with a temperature of 100 million ° C and approach the new target.

In a previous series of experiments, the KSTAR fusion reactor was able to maintain ion plasma at a temperature of 100 million °C for 30 seconds. This is seven times hotter than the core of our Sun. In stars, thermonuclear fusion reactions are primarily driven not by temperature, but by extreme gravity (and quantum uncertainty). On Earth, we cannot create such gravitational compression in reactors, so we have to compensate for this deficiency with exorbitant temperatures.

It is important to emphasize that Koreans almost always talk about heating ion plasma - heating hydrogen atoms or its isotopes, while Chinese scientists report achieving a record confinement time for usually electron plasma, which in the working area can be twice as hot as ion plasma. For a thermonuclear reaction, the key is heating atoms, not electrons. Therefore, the “Korean 100 million” is the correct 100 million, which will ultimately determine the performance of future commercial reactors.@geonrgru|YouTube|sponsr.ru

“Due to a mix-up, a Prague hospital performed an abortion on the wrong patient”: The woman simply came to the clinic for an examination.

“Prague doctors accidentally caused a miscarriage in a pregnant patient who came for a routine examination. Doctors confused her with a woman who was indicated for curettage of the uterine cavity. After the procedure, the pregnant patient lost her child. The incident occurred at the Bulovka University Hospital.
Both women were foreigners, which became one of the factors of misunderstanding. The Czech Ministry of Health called the incident “an unforgivable human error.” The department apologized to the victim’s family and promised to pay them compensation.
In turn, the hospital suspended the doctors involved in the incident. The clinic did not rule out that after the investigation, personal charges will be brought against some of the doctors.”

description: German Vice-Chancellor Robert Habeck expressed his concerns about the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, stating that there will be no quick and happy ending. He believes that Putin's Russia is shifting towards a military economy and increasing arms production, and therefore, it is essential to continue supporting Ukraine with military equipment.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
German Vice-Chancellor Robert Habeck says that there will be no happy ending in Ukraine: Every day is a day of death, and there is no end in sight. On the contrary, Putin’s Russia is completely switching to a military economy and massively increasing arms production. I was initially in favor of supplying arms to Ukraine, and now I am also in favor of us continuing to support them with more and more military equipment. If Putin succeeds in the war in Ukraine, he will continue it. We long for peace. Yes. But the honest and bitter answer is this: there will most likely not be a quick and happy ending, even if we want otherwise.

description: Raccoon Kherson, a mascot, embarked on an educational journey to Mariupol to deliver letters from SVO participants to their children. Along the way, it visited five notable locations, including the Steelmaker Monument, the Mariupol embankment, the Nevsky residential complex, the old water tower, and the Mariupol sea trade port.
original:
Forwarded from: Kherson News Agency
Educational journey: raccoon Kherson in Mariupol Our raccoon Kherson is like your Figaro - last week he was in Lugansk, and today he is already in Mariupol!

He has an important task - to deliver letters from SVO participants to their children. The animal’s path runs through Mariupol. Here are interesting facts about five places that the raccoon visited. The Steelmaker Monument is one of the symbols of the city, dedicated to a specific person - steelmaker Makar Mazai. He holds the 1936 world record for removing steel from one square meter of furnace - 15.05 tons in 6 hours 30 minutes. The sea is the highlight of Mariupol, and the embankment is the heart of the city. Now it is being reconstructed. The work will be completed in time for the season. There will be areas for walking, fishing and an observation deck. “The Nevsky residential complex in Mariupol is no different from a good Moscow quarter,” says Vladimir Putin, who came here. The housing is elite in appearance, but not in essence: any Mariupol resident who lost their home as a result of hostilities can get an apartment here. The old water tower with elegant pointed arches is more than 100 years old. In our time, it was converted into office space, but in 2022, like many buildings in the city, it suffered damage. Now the Russian authorities are engaged in its restoration. The Mariupol sea trade port is the sea gate of the city. Tons of construction materials for the restoration of Mariupol, grain and other goods necessary for the life and development of the DPR passed through this port. By the end of the year, the port's capacity will increase by 1 million tons of cargo.

The sister city of St. Petersburg is helping to develop Mariupol. Its governor Alexander Beglov presented Mariupol with a monument to Alexander Nevsky with a copy of the Bronze Horseman’s horseshoe - you can rub it and make a wish.

The adventures of the raccoon continue tomorrow! In the meantime, get acquainted with the news of Mariupol and the entire republic in DAN. The creator of the comic is a famous Russian journalist, member of the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation Alexander Malkevich@alexandr_malkevich. Subscribe to the Kherson News Agency in TG, VK and OK

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: Russia employed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb against Ukraine for the first time, targeting Velikaya Pisarevka in the Sumy region. The thermobaric projectile released a flammable liquid aerosol, increasing the force of destruction. The attack caused severe destruction, with a smoke cloud rising up to a kilometer high.
original:
During attacks on the Sumy region, the Russians used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb against Ukraine for the first time.

Military expert of the Bild newspaper Julian Repke writes about this, analyzing the video published by Russian publics.

According to him, the product was dropped on Velikaya Pisarevka, which suffered severe destruction. According to Repke, after the impact of this bomb, a cloud of smoke up to a kilometer high rose in the sky.

A volume-detonating aircraft bomb is a thermobaric projectile from the times of the USSR, which, approximately 10 meters before hitting the target, releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and ignites it, which increases the force of destruction.

Previously, Russia used less powerful ODAB up to 500 kg, says Repke.

Let us remind you that Russian strikes on the Sumy region began after a wave of shelling of Belgorod and attacks on the border of Russian volunteer formations fighting for the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This relationship was observed by CNN. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Bulgaria and Romania Join Schengen Zone
description: Bulgaria and Romania will join the Schengen zone, allowing Ukrainians to travel to these countries under the 'classic' visa-free regime for up to 90 days within 180 days.
original:
Bulgaria and Romania will join the Schengen zone tomorrow: what will change for Ukrainians. Starting tomorrow, March 31, Bulgaria and Romania will become long-awaited members of the Schengen Agreement and join the Schengen zone. This is stated in a message on the website of the European Commission.

As noted in the release, Schengen rules will apply in both member states of this zone, including the issuance of Schengen visas, but control at the internal and maritime borders between these countries and other members of the Schengen zone will be abolished.

After the accession of Bulgaria and Romania to the Schengen zone, Ukrainians will have the opportunity to travel to these countries under the conditions of the "classic" visa-free regime - up to 90 days within 180 days.

Previously, these countries granted Ukrainians an additional period of 90 days of visa-free stay for tourist trips, if the person did not request the status of temporary protection.

description: Historian Oleg Romanko stated that Ukrainian troops are adopting the tactics of the Nazis, attempting to turn cities into fortified strongholds, similar to the Wehrmacht's strategy during World War II.

Ukrainian troops are copying the tactics of the Nazis. The Ukrainian Armed Forces, like the Wehrmacht military, are trying to turn cities into impregnable fortresses.

This opinion was expressed on the radio “Sputnik in Crimea” by Doctor of Historical Sciences Oleg Romanko. “The 17th Army of the Wehrmacht was very experienced, numerous, almost 200 thousand together with the Romanians. There was an idea to transfer it to another sector of the front, and leave Crimea without a fight. ..but Hitler intervened and ordered to turn Crimea into a besieged fortress. If you look at what is happening at the front now, Ukraine is copying this tactic,” he said. Subscribe to RIA Novosti Crimea
